I have a small project for Potter that we need to do.
 
Potter's literature fulfillment house will send them (via FTP I believe) a file each day with the literature that was sent.  We need to turn these records into literature fulfillments in SLX.

TicketProblem.Notes: Install the signature feature on the Tension system (same as we built for Intoximeters).  Users want to have the ability to add scanned signatures to mail merges and reports.  The scanned signatures need to go into a field on the USERINFO table or some other place that can be accessed w/Mail Merge.  If this cannot be done natively, then we need to create a new field and add a custom reference to it (in VBScript).

TicketSolution.Notes:
I've applied this on their production system. I used the identical management interface we gave Intoximeters to allow them to add images. The management interface (Tools --> Manage --> User Signatures) is only accessible by Kathy, Brad and Susan. 

I have also added a new word template and released it to everyone called "Base Letter - With Signature". This is the template that has their logo in the header and will have the signature file embedded in the mail merge document. Any future word templates they want with the signature embedded will have to be based on this template. The other alternative is they can add the special SLX Mail Merge field to their documents, and the merge field has to be called: 
Custom_UserSignature

This embedded signature can also be used in any Crystal Report they wish. The signature is stored in a custom table called C_USER_SIGNATURE in a field called SIGNATURE and it can be joined to via the USERID field.

The only thing is I have not been able to test this in their own environment since their server does not have Word on it. I've sent Brad an email requesting him to install MS Office on the server if possible so we can use it for future testing/troubleshooting of mail merge documents.

I need 2 reports pulled from SLX/MAS at QSI and sent to both Jennifer and Chris:

TicketProblem.Notes:
Sometimes QSI pays a vendor with a credit card.  In these cases, we do not want to double-pay them by creating another vendor payment in MAS for them when a ticket is closed.  

Need to add a checkbox on the invoice in SLX -- "Paid Vendor with CC".  If this is checked, do not send a vendor payment to MAS.

TicketSolution.Notes:
I've added this checkbox to the Invoice but had some questions:

1) I assume this can only be checked before the invoice has been posted to MAS after which it is locked down and only the Invoice Admins can modify it?
2) I assume this value needs to be sent over to MAS? If so we will need to notify Tom to modify the VI job accordingly and possibly display this in MAS so users know not to send the vendor a payment.

TicketProblem.Notes:
Some customers will pay multiple tickets with a single PO.  These customers want all of these tickets to show up on 1 invoice.  So when the data is sent to MAS, we need a way to roll up these tickets into a single invoice.  There is a 1-1 relationship in SLX between tickets/invoices that we do not want to break, so we should leave this intact and design something that does the roll-ups between SLX and MAS.  

This needs to be both designed and implemented.  Contact Jennifer or Chris for more details and discussions of possible solutions.

TicketSolution.Notes:
Will discuss with Jennifer and Chris on Tuesday Feb 16th.

Spoke with Jennifer and Chris and will need to discuss the options with Tom McElroy about the feasability on the MAS side of things.


Everything has been implemented, just awaiting Tom McElroy's VI jobs and end user testing

Closed on 4/1/2011 - In Production

TicketProblem.Notes: We’d like to change the business logic in SLX on how the system determines duplicate relationships (opportunities).  Currently right now, it makes sure that SLX doesn’t already have the same type (Licensee, LicenseeAffiliate, etc) for the same product (MPEG-2, 1394, etc).  That has worked for us up until now.  We now need to add to that check.  For relationship types of LicenseeAffiliate or LicensorAffiliate (that have a parent associated to it), we need to check that the parent is not the same as another.  This means that you could have a relationship of type LicenseeAffiliate in MPEG-2 but for two different parents.  Let me know if that makes sense and if you need any more info for this request.

TicketProblem.Notes:
We have a new addition we would like to make to the laser branding options in SLX.  Can you send us an estimated quote and timeline for this?
 
We want to add the ability to have sequential numbering as an option in our laser branding text line fields.  
This would be used similar to the “Special” option where we choose “Special” for a text line, and then type in the box next to the field exactly the text that we want for that line.  

We would now have an additional field option called “Sequential Numbering” available as an option for any of the 5 lines.  We would then need two textboxes to appear for the user: one to enter the format of the sequential numbering and one to enter the starting number.  Perhaps these could popup for the user requesting this information.
 
For example:
•	The user could select “Sequential Numbering” for Line 5.  
•	The format for the first text box would have a place holder of "##" to indicate where the sequential number should be located in the string and how many digits should be present.  
•	The user could then enter something similar to “A1####” in the first text box to show that the string should begin with “A1” and have a 4-digit number after.  This could also be done as "####A1" or "P7####A1".  We might need some error checking with this to ensure that the user enters a valid format with at least one and only one sequential section.  
•	The user could enter a “20” in the second new text box to indicate that the numbering starts at 20 for this line.  This will also need to have some error checking included.
•	During the export to the barcode database, this could be exported as "Special" and the text data will be populated based on the two user fields entered for that line in SLX.  
•	The text data for Line 5 for this group of barrels would be populated as "A10021", "A10022", "A10023", etc.

TicketSolution.Notes: Implemented in production

TicketProblem.Notes: See attached email for more description

TicketSolution.Notes:
For Item #1:
Typically the first thing to do is to run the InstallOutlookIntegration.bat file to see if it fixes the issue. However since that did not work for you the next step is to unregister the required files and re-register them.
To do this please follow these steps on the user’s machine:
1)	Close SalesLogix and Outlook (make sure Outlook has exited completely by loading the windows task manager and ensuring that under the Processes tab, Outlook.exe is not listed).
2)	Go to the command prompt (Start ? Run ? Type the command “cmd” without quotes ? Click OK
3)	Go to the SalesLogix directory (enter the command “cd \Program Files\SalesLogix”)
4)	Enter the command: regsvr32 /u slxab32.dll
5)	You should get a message saying DLLUnregister succeeded
6)	Enter the command: regsvr32 /u slmn.dll
7)	You should get a message saying DLLUnregister succeeded
8)	Now enter the command: InstallOutlookIntegration.bat
9)	You should see 2 prompts saying Register succeeded

Hopefully this will now resolve the issue, however if the issue persists or if any of the commands mentioned above do not work as expected, please have the user give me a call and we can look at it over a Gotoassist session.


For Item #2:
I’m sorry this has been an issue for so long. This was a bug in the code. I have now added checks for all the fields on that form to ensure that none of the field values exceed the allowed length of their corresponding fields in the database. So this issue should be resolved now. Please let me know if you still have issues with this.

For Item #3:
This one will require some troubleshooting. My suspicion here is that the culprit here may be Intellisync but I am not sure. I’d ideally like to look at this on a machine that’s having the issue and try a few things out like disabling Intellisync temporarily to see if the issue still persists. Can you please give me a call when you have a moment and we can look at this one over a Gotoassist. If you like I can troubleshoot item #1 as well during this call.

TicketProblem.Notes:
Once a Quick Ticket is saved the user that created the ticket receives a notification every two hours until the  Dispatched check box is filled in. Please change the notification to be every hour. Also, please have Cory Kroupa CCed on all of those notifications.

Follow up:
We're looking for a 1 hour turnaround time so setting the system to run every 30 minutes should work. Also, we would want the updates to continue to go out until the quick ticket is Dispatched, Cancelled or converted into a regular ticket.

TicketSolution.Notes:
The job currently runs every 10 mins, looks for Quick Tickets that have not been marked as complete and sends out an email notification. Once the notification has been sent, it is not resent.

Would you like this to be changed and have it send out notifications every 30 mins? If so, we can change the job to run every 30 mins so it sends out repeat notifications? The downside to be aware of here is that there is a chance that if a quick ticket is entered at 10:31 am and the job runs at 11 am, it will skip the quick ticket since it is not 30 mins old as yet. It will send out the first notification at 11:30 am (which is 59 minutes later). 

What we could do to overcome this issue is to have the job look for tickets that are 15 mins old (or basically a smaller time interval than what the job's scheduled run interval is) so that it picks up on these quick tickets as well. What happens here is that on the plus side, you will definitely receive notifications for tickets within a maximum of 30 mins....however the downside is you may receive notifications for a ticket that is just 15 mins old as well.

Please let me know your thoughts.


Follow up Response:
I've implemented the changes for this task, however before I turn the notifications on, I wanted to check with you. 

I'm noticing that at the moment there are 125 quick tickets in your database that meet the criteria and if we turn this notification on, you'll get 125 email notifications every 30 mins. 
I didn't want to flood your mailboxes so I wanted to make sure what you'd like to do here. If you like we can put in a criteria to only send you notifications for quicktickets entered after today.

Implemented on 9/2/2010 and ticket is being closed

The RFI Exchange server currently has a 15MB limit on outbound email, and there are times when large work order bundles are sent out that exceed this amount.

Currently all work orders are sent out in a single email, one per crew member, regardless of total size.

Proposed enhancement is to break apart these outbound work order emails into multiples if the total exceeds 15MB.

Example: 15 work orders are being sent to a crew member. Each work order is 2MB, so the total of all 15 is 30MB. This single file would be rejected by the mail server if sent as a single attachment. Under this enhanced change, 3 emails will be sent to the crew member: the first with 7 attachments (14MB), a second with 7 attachments (14MB), and a third with 1 attachment (1MB). All file sizes would be under the 15MB limit.

Estimate for this effort is 4h.

$resources.Subject: Port MO Mulch Order/Invoice interface to Independent Stave

TicketProblem.Notes:
Hey Nick -
 
I'm writing a formal specification for Independent Stave - Orders/Invoice/Products modules - but I thought I would quickly send you some of the business rules that I documented so you can get started.
 
This is the list of business rules, in no particular order:
 
Ordres can have only 1 ship-to address (and 1 contact) 
Ship-to addresses can change during the order, so in the order history table/grids we will need to add the ship-to address so the user knows where the product went 
Ship-to addresses must be in the database (default to the account ship-to) 
Will use the "review" process that MO Mulch uses 
Sales admin teams can ship product 
Need to add details about barrels in the order - toast, etc.  So an order can have >1 group of the same item (each with different details).  In other words, an order can have 5 line items for Barrel X, each with a different configuration (item1 has mild toast, item2 has medium toast, etc).  
Prices should be static, but also allow for prices to impact existing orders that are not confirmed (reviewed).  In other words, if a product price changes, we want to allow for the option to change the price for all existing orders that have not been confirmed. 
Shipping/handling charges are handled at the order level, not the product level 
Quantity discounts are not allowed 
Sales tax is not currently calculated if the account is not tax exempt.  Sales tax will need to be calculated per product in the new system. 
Allow for price overrides for sales admin group 
There are 2 price schedules - MO and NAPA.  MO applies for any sales shipped from MO (FOB MO) to anywhere besides CA, OR, WA.  FOB NAPA applies to CA, OR, WA unless there is a full truck.  Need to allow sales person to choose FOB pricing scheme.  Pricing applies to the entire order. 
Quantity break applies to the entire order, not by product 
MO has no inventory 
NAPA has inventory - qty on hand, qty available.  If a product is not available in NAPA, it is ordered thru MO.  Back orders are not done. 
RMA's are not done. 
Orders can be partially shipped (as in MO Mulch) 
Cannot invoice for more product than has been shipped 
1 order can span >1 invoice 
Cannot alter the quantity of an order less than what has been shipped 
Invoices are generated daily. 
Once an invoice has been entered, want to be able to edit the bill-to information (and nothing else). 
If an invoice is incorrect and has been paid, users will do a credit memo and not a price adjustment. 
All payments will be handled in Great Plains.  Want import to mark an invoice as paid (closed).

TicketSolution.Notes:
Customizations have been set up on the test server (sssapp3).
Waiting for feedback from SS.
Will set up a meeting tomorrow (6/13) for review.

TicketProblem.Notes:
From: Traci Louvier, Repco Graphics [mailto:tlouvier@repcographics.com] 
Sent: Thursday, July 28, 2005 7:52 AM
To: Nicolas Galler
Cc: smohan@sssworld.com; Fritz Zaegel, Repco Graphics
Subject: RE: Laird June 2005 Activity Report


Nick -
Thanks for the summary.  And yes, I agree with you on:
Let's suppress the 0/0 items from the reports as these will only confuse our customers 
Have the original request appear on the weekly or monthly activity report when it actually happens to show backordered items being generated (5 ordered, 0 shipped) 
When the backordered item is filled, say a month later, it then appears on that activity report as 5 ordered, 5 shipped - we have one client in particular that watches very closely for these backorders to be filled
Let me know when you resolve the last item noted below.  And as always, thanks for your help!
Traci
-----Original Message-----
From: Nicolas Galler [mailto:ngaller@sssworld.com]
Sent: Wednesday, July 27, 2005 6:08 PM
To: Traci Louvier, Repco Graphics
Cc: smohan@sssworld.com
Subject: RE: Laird June 2005 Activity Report


Hi, Traci,
 
I looked at one of the requests (the one for Mark Barrett), one of the item was back-ordered in May which caused both of them to print on the June report, but since there was no activity in June they printed with 0. The second item was finally shipped in July. The interesting thing is that none of the May, June, or July reports will show any of these items... they will only be shown in April, because that is the time the original request was back-ordered (the May request was itself a back-order of that one).
 
It seems to me one of 2 things should be done:
* suppress the 0/0 items from the reports... this would be easy to do
* show the request in that report, in the month it is actually shipped... the problem being that in the case of backorder the filldate may be very different from the actual ship date. This would be a bit harder to do but more interesting in my opinion... although there may well be a valid reason for setting up the system the way it is now
 
By the way, interestingly enough, on the April report the other item prints with a ship quantity of 19, ordered quantity of 10... and the total ship quantity which I can obtain by summing the various request is 10 (as it should be)... that problem is not directly related but I am now investigating it also (I will probably install a quick fix for that one tonight)
 
Thanks
Nick

TicketProblem.Notes: I created a Crystal report for viewing Contracts, Accounts and Associated Contacts for the Accounts. When I log into SalesLogix as Admin, the report shows up fine with all fields. TicketSolution.Notes:
Looked at customer's database and found that for some reason the SalesLogix DB views had bad data in them. Specifically, the ACCESSID_ column had incorrect data and that was causing the problem in Crystal for users other than the administrator.

To resolve the issue, we've written a SQL script that drops the SalesLogix views and recreates them. That resolved the problem.

1/20/2006:
King Innovation was upgraded today to SLX 6.23 and we are awaiting feedback from Andrea if the problem still persists.

1/20/2006:
Notified by Andrea that the problem still persists. Appears to be an issue with some products and not others.

1/23/2006:
Looked into the issue and noticed that Products which did not have Pricing descriptions could not be added to a SLX Opportunity Product list. Since the products were coming in via the import from Great Plains, we added a script to update the products each night to default to a pricing description of "Retail".
Notified Andrea accordingly and the issue has been resolved.

TicketProblem.Notes:
Got this after I entered a follow-up phone call.
Sync Error Occurred - The selected account for calendar section does not exist. You have to re-configure this section.!

TicketSolution.Notes:
From the SLX Knowledgebase
Possible Resolution: Reset the Intellisync connector
   1. Close SalesLogix and the e-mail client
   2. Use Windows Explorer to browse to C:\program files\saleslogix\slxintellisync (An Intellisync folder may exist as well or instead of.  If so, open this folder and go to Step 3.)
   3. Delete the user and user.cfg folders (for example: JDoe and JDoe.cfg)
   4. Close Windows Explorer
   5. Select Start / Run and type in Regedit
   6. Go to C:\HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\SalesLogix
   7. Locate the SLX_Intellisync and SLXIntellisync folders (both or one will exist)
   8. Delete the folder(s)
   9. Exit Regedit
  10. Log back on to the SalesLogix Client and configure Intellisync

TicketProblem.Notes: I am trying to automate our inventory in the Tools>Manage>Literature but I am having an issue and need help.  When I set up a Sample Kit throgh manage literature that includes several different components, such as samples and catalog inserts, how do i get that to lower my on hand count when I schedule a literature request for a contact?

TicketSolution.Notes:
Appears that user was not fullfilling literature requests. Literature item's quantity on hand only goes down when the literature request is fulfilled by clicking on Tools menu --> Literature Fulfillment and then hilighting one of the scheduled Literature requests and then clicking on the Fulfill button on the top of the screen. Once this is completed, it will reduce the quantity on hand by the necessary amount. 

Update:
User indicated that she was fulfilling literature requests and inventory levels were still not being reduced. Reason was that user was referring to 2 separate literature items as a KIT and expected each literature items quantity on hand to be reduced when the KIT was scheduled in a lit request. However there was no link between the kit and the individual items.

Resolution:
Informed user that this functionality was not available in stock SalesLogix and she would have to track each literature item as a separate entity and add both items while scheduling a literature request in order to track correct inventory levels for each item.

$resources.Subject: Write custom application to update history data in Saleslogix from UPS

TicketProblem.Notes:
Hi Nick.

 

We’d like to solicit your help with something.  We’d like to automatically update the notes field in the completed literature request with the UPS tracking number(s).

 

I’ve created a new table in the SalesLogix database, C_UPS_SHIPMENTS, and this table is automatically populated with each UPS shipment that we send out of the UPS Worldship system.  Unfortunately, we couldn’t selectively write to this table (a limitation of the Worldship system), so it has ALL UPS shipments, not just those in response to a SLX literature request.

 

We’d like to add a trigger that fires when a row is inserted into this new table.  The trigger should run a stored procedure that:

ð        Checks to see if a SLX contact exists (we fill out the CONTACTID field with the “Reference1” field from the shipment):

o        If the contact doesn’t exist, delete the row from the C_UPS_SHIPMENTS table

o        If the contact does exist:

§         Look for the HISTORY row in SLX that corresponds to the literature request.  (See note below)

§         When the literature request history record is found:

·         If the VOIDINDICATOR is “N”, append the NOTES and LONGNOTES fields from the HISTORY table with a string that says “UPS ” & 

the TRACKINGNUMBER field from the C_UPS_SHIPMENTS table & a carriage return.

·         If the VOIDINDICATOR is “Y”, append the NOTES and LONGNOTES fields from the HISTORY table with a string that says “Voided UPS Shipment” & 

the TRACKINGNUMBER field from the C_UPS_SHIPMENTS table & a carriage return.

·         Update the HISTORYID field in the C_UPS_SHIPMENTS table with the index to the HISTORY table

§         When the literature request history record is not found, skip the record.  (We’ll have a manual report to clean these up.)

 

NOTE:  Since we’re not able to print the literature request ID on either the letter or the label from SLX, there’s no way to get this specific field in the UPS system, and therefore, matching it back up with the history record will have to be a best-guess attempt.  If we look for any completed literature requests in the history table for this contact for the same date (ie, the history record was created the same date as the shipment date), we should be pretty good.  There’s a slight chance that we’d ship two literature requests to the same contact on the same day, and in that rare case, since this “note” is informational only, go ahead and update it on both records.  (If there’s some way to append the note indicating that there were multiple records updated, that would be great.  And, we’d have to know that the HISTORYID in the C_UPS_SHIPMENTS table would be from the last record updated.)

 

Also, it doesn’t matter that the C_UPS_SHIPMENTS table isn’t sync’d out to the remotes, but we’d obviously want the updated NOTES fields to be sync’d out… that is, after all, the whole reason for putting the tracking number into SLX.

TicketSolution.Notes:
Need update to catalog request bundle: history records are not correctly produced when fulfilling request that was entered as a catalog request
Need a custom application ("Magnet LitRequest UPS Update")

1/24: Setup the app, waiting for Rene' to specify how she wants to do testing

App was setup and scheduled.  Logs will be cleaned up after 45 days.

$resources.Subject: Realigning Contacts using a SQL Query

TicketProblem.Notes:
Jeff wanted to realign contacts. Semi-Bulk assigns an Account Manager based on the geographic region of the contact.
He was attempting the query
UPDATE A1.ACCOUNTMANAGERID='MY NEW VALUE' FROM CONTACT A1 INNER JOIN ADDRESS A2 ON (A1.ADDRESSID=A2.ADDRESSID) WHERE (A2.STATE='TN.') OR (A2.STATE='TN') AND (A1.ACCOUNTMANAGERID='U6UJ9A00000A')

TicketSolution.Notes:
1/26/2006:
Asked Jeff to try:
update a1 set a1.accountmanagerid = 'MYNEWVALUE' from contact a1 inner join 
address a2 on a1.addressid = a2.addressid where (a2.state = 'TN' OR a2.state 
= 'TN.') and a1.accountmanagerid = 'U6UJ9A00000A' 


1/27/2006:
Jeff responded that the above query did not work.

Asked him to try this one instead:
update contact set accountmanagerid = 'U6UJ9A00000N' where accountmanagerid = 'U6UJ9A00000A' and addressid in (select addressid from address where state = 'TN' or state = 'TN.')

TicketProblem.Notes:
When an agent terminates, I pull up the Contacts screen/Agent Association tab to see what active accounts are still in that agent's name.  If there are any, we contact the Agency to see whom else needs to be named as servicing agent on the termed agent's cases.

Connected to production database and noticed that the account "Employee Benefits Design LLC" had an invalid address entry. As a result, it was not getting listed in the All Accounts group and nor was it being pulled up by the lookup. TicketProblem.Notes:
When the Individual Department creates a Contact - Individual type, an account is automatically created with the lastname/firstname.  Normally, the Individual Dept does nothing with this account level file so whatever is created on this record when they create the contact is what stays.  

Ex.  Christy Ann Saffle (agent) recently left her firm.  I pulled up the Agent Association tab to see what active cases she had attributed to her name so I could change those cases to the new agent in her place. Carrie Holte is an active individual under the "Contacts" section, however her associated "Account" record shows "none" as status.

TicketProblem.Notes:
Trying to kick off reports and getting the following error message:
Error running selected report.  Please ensure the report exists and the database connection is defined.  Element not found.

TicketSolution.Notes:
Asked Susan to reregister the Crystal DLLs by following these steps:
 
1) Close the SalesLogix Client as well as the Architect.
2) From C:\Windows\Crystal copy and paste the crviewer.dll into the directory C:\Program Files\Seagate Software\Viewers\ActiveXViewer
3) Click on Start --> Run and type the following command
regsvr32 C:\Windows\Crystal\craxdrt.dll
You should see a message saying craxdrt.dll successfully registered.
4) Click on Start --> Run and type the following command
regsvr32 C:\Windows\Crystal\crviewer.dll
You should see a message saying crviewer.dll successfully registered.


Susan confirmed that this resolved the issue. Ticket is being closed.

$resources.Subject: Cutting a remote DB for a new user

TicketProblem.Notes: I have a remote user we just created. New laptop, fresh load, new remote database. Database loads blank. We have re-installed slx, outlook, and did the database three times. Have had two people double check settings. Each time database loads blank. Can someone give me a call and give some ideas here.

TicketSolution.Notes:
Asked Randy to check the subscription rules for that user. The new user is probably not subscribed to any accounts / contacts which is why the database is showing up blank.
To check this, login to the SLX Administrator as the admin.
Right click on the new user and choose Edit User
On the Sync Tab, click on "SYNC All Accounts that User can access (May slow sync)"
Now click OK and then cut a new database. 

2/1/2006:
Randy confirmed that the issue has been resolved. Ticket is being closed.

Also fixed the configuration to create the activities correctly.
2/3: Andrea says they are able to see the new customer, and other recently created accounts are also showing up correctly.

TicketProblem.Notes: We have a user that has Crystal 9 loaded on their machine and when they try to run a Crystal report within SalesLogix, we get a "Crystal Runtime Error" and the report doesn't show. The OS is Win XP and we are running 6.2.3.1092. No one else has this problem.

TicketSolution.Notes:
Informed Kevin that Crystal 9 is not supported but had him try to reregister the Crystal DLLS anyway by following these steps:

1) Close the SalesLogix Client 
2) From C:\Windows\Crystal copy and paste the crviewer.dll into the directory C:\Program Files\Seagate Software\Viewers\ActiveXViewer
3) Click on Start --> Run and type the following command
regsvr32 C:\Windows\Crystal\craxdrt.dll
 
You should see a message saying craxdrt.dll successfully registered.
 
4) Click on Start --> Run and type the following command
regsvr32 C:\Windows\Crystal\crviewer.dll
 
You should see a message saying crviewer.dll successfully registered.
 
Now launch saleslogix and the reports should work.

Kevin confirmed that this solved the problem and ticket is being closed.

TicketProblem.Notes:
We have had a few instances over the past few months where contacts or accounts have 'disappeared' unbeknownst to us until we tried to access them in SLX.  I think I might have found the root cause (although I have no idea why).  
 
Today, when I was in SLX under an Account called Tech Chem Inc. - It had an incorrect address entered.  When Regina and I tried to change the address (the primary address which had no assigned name like 'mailing' ) we received errors -- I wish I could say exactly what the error said, but it was an error that said we didnt' have authorization.  Yet - when I went in to delete this address, and got the errors again, it still deleted the incorrect address.  We then entered a 'mailing' address for the group and it seemed the system accepted it. Now - the group is gone.  Regina went out of SLX and reloaded it and it's still gone.  
 
When I checked with the others that have recently had issues with disappearing contacts and accounts, it appears it's always when an address is altered or deleted.  There is no warning that the file is being deleted - it just disappears from our database.  Not sure if the upgrade will fix this, but this is becoming a problem since we've now lost 4 groups or contacts because of this anomoly.  

I've sent this issue to you guys before and it was determined that the user deleted this.  They swear they did not delete the record, now we have more instances where this is occurring.  I don't think it is a user issue but a system issue.

TicketSolution.Notes:
ADDRESSID field was being set to null and as a result the Account would not show up in any group since the join would fail.

The cause of this is probably due to the fact that a little under 22,000 ADDRESS table entries are missing the DESCRIPTION field value which is required.


Restored about 10 such accounts and will update the ADDRESS description of the blank ADDRESSES.

Ticket is being closed.

$resources.Subject: Ticket dropdown displays opp groups in topnav

TicketProblem.Notes:
There is an issue that seems to be related time wise to the service pack installation. 

The Ticket Group no longer displays the correct Ticket group drop down list.  It appears to be displaying the Opportunities drop down list instead.

TicketSolution.Notes:
Change in groupmanager.js; the code for retrieving groups had (intcode==8?2|intcode), which means if the intcode was 8 (the magic number value for tickets) then it would switch to 2 (the magic number value for opportunities), and read the values from that list. 

It's bizarre that this happens in four places throughout the file, so it's obviously intentional, but there's no real documentation to explain why this is happening. I removed it, and could not find any problems that were caused by it, so it should be safe.

I'm assuming what you would like to do here is mail merges from the Plan level. Well unfortunately SalesLogix mail merges are Contact centric so performing mail merges on plans will not work out of the box unless we uniquely identify a contact to be associated to one and only one plan. Susan Responded (3/28/2007):

5/16/2007:

TicketProblem.Notes: We have a query called "Terms - DA" and when she shorts by date, it's sorting by month of the date field not the year.  I had her, for the time being, export to Excel to get the data sorted correctly, but can this be fixed for future queries?

TicketSolution.Notes:
The field in question is actually being saved to USERFIELD9 which is a text field so the sorting is a text based sort and not a date based sort. 

Possible solutions are: 
1. Export the data to excel which will sort it correctly
2. A better long term solution is to copy all the USERFIELD9 data into a new custom date field and change the field mapping to point to the new custom field so the sorting works correctly.


Ticket Closed on 6/4/2007:
Susan chose to go with Option 1 for now.

TicketProblem.Notes: Individual Department said that when they use to fill literature requests, SLX would print the request (blank pages) then would print a label page. Now the label page isn't printing -- since the last upgrade to SLX was done.

When you click on Tools --> Literature Fulfillment, on the Literature Fulfillment screen that comes up, right on the top there is a Print Labels option which is probably set to No Labels by default. Change that to the type of labels you'd like and you should have the labels print.

Steven modified a form and was getting errors when he tried to run it. I modified it slightly while he headed to a meeting. Here is the e-mail I sent him. Total time to resolution: 30 minutes

TicketSolution.Notes:
The problem in the form is with the field names. I started fixing the code so that it checks if the field names exist, but the problem is that the given labels may or may not exist. IE: They’re numbered wrong, in an incorrect order. I think this is more necessary to correct at this point, but I don’t know what will happen if I start changing the field names. 


For example: There is no number 9 or number 15 check box or date field in the list.

 

I added a check for each one to the code to make sure that if the control doesn’t exist that it’s not going to error out (IE: if control is nothing), but I’m not sure if this is the best way to go about this. 

 

Also, I noticed that they aren’t numbered in the correct order. The code’s goal is to go through and go from date 1, check 1 …, date 2, check 2… date 3, check 3… etc. But if these fields aren’t in the correct numeric order then the tab options aren’t going to work, and they will just kind of ‘flop’ all over the place. 

 

Finally, I noticed that chk15 is mentioned in several places in the code, and I’ve commented it out where I saw it. Probably was replaced with a different check box. 

 

That’s all I saw, and I think you should be good to go after making a few more changes like these. If you need further help, let me know.

TicketSolution.Notes:
Suggested the following clean up steps:
1) Stop the Speedsearch service
2) Run the following statement in the Administrator: DELETE FROM INDEXUPDATES WHERE INDEXNAME=’Activity’
3) Delete the folder (on the server): C:\Program Files\SalesLogix\SpeedSearch\SALESLOGIX\Data\Collections\Activity (note – the name may be slightly different on your system.  It is based on the name of your Saleslogix database.  If you have trouble locating the file, Go to Start -> Program -> Saleslogix -> Speedsearch Configuration)
4) Restart the speedsearch service.


They indicated they preferred not to run the cleanup manually and wait for a more permanent fix:
From: Chris Jordan 
Sent: Wednesday, April 09, 2008 12:30 PM
To: Candy Fink; Devi Paruchuri; Mike Zerwig
Subject: RE: SLX SQL Error question
That object is owned by sysdba.  When I changed the query to the following it shows 11119 rows.
SELECT COUNT(*) FROM SYSDBA.INDEXUPDATES WHERE INDEXNAME='Activity'
The delete statement should be changed to specify sysdba.
I'm not inclined to delete anything manually.  I would rather see the process fixed so this doesn't creep up again.  Let me know what you think.
Chris Jordan

TicketProblem.Notes: It looks like France is having trouble entering Rough Staves and Rough Heading, they keep getting errors.  Would you know of a reason why?  It shouldn't be different than any other product.

TicketSolution.Notes:
Localization error.  The numbers are getting formatted in French locale which is not valid for SQL server.  I added a function FormatNumberNoLocale to prevent the localization.  This will have to be called whenever a number is used in a SQL statement (NOTE DoUpdate and DoInsert are fine and don't need adjusted)

See forum post on http://slxdeveloper.com/forum.aspx?forumid=2000&postid=15158

Galler, Nicolas 4/2/2008 1:20:14 PM (Central Standard Time)
Installed updated bundle on their system

This depends on which type of group you are trying to create, is it a Plan group or a Contact group?

Thanks!
Anosh

•	LA Signed Site App’d w/o Bldg Permit = SLX group “LA wo BP” (License Agreement Module)

•	Future License Commitments = SLX group “Future License Commitments” (Development Agreement Module)

Trish also mentionned 2 problems with the status detail reports:

I sent this info to Steve about which groups it should be using:
Property: Under Construction does NOT match the report’s criteria.  If you want to update that group to the correct criteria let me know and I will update the report
Property: LA Signed Site App No BP – this one matches the report criteria.  So if you could please update the group’s criteria then I will copy it to the report.

Future License Commitment – I changed the report to match the group’s criteria (the only difference was the report was checking for status <> Inactive, whereas the group was checking for status = Active)

In case you ever want or need to edit the report criteria yourself (not suggesting that you do but I just thought you ought to know just in case) you would have to edit the following SQL views:
sss_StrategicPartner_Summary
sss_StrategicPartner_MarketDetail
sss_StrategicPartner_StatusDetail
sss_StrategicPartner_List

Trish indicated that this first issue was caused by duplicate records, and she was able to resolve it by editing the data.

The date issue is caused by the Saleslogix provider converting the date (because the data is returned by a view and it doesnt know about the view's columns).  This can be fixed by editing the SQL to add 12 hours to the DATE columns (NOT the datetime columns!).

TicketProblem.Notes:
Sometimes they are unable to log into Saleslogix.  Restarting the Saleslogix service fixes the issue.


We're having a bit of a problem with Saleslogix.  We have the SLX adapter and SLXSystem installed on a server as a service.  An application connects to SLX through this machine to update information.  Generally, this works fine.  The application makes a request, the service (SLXSystem.exe) wakes up, the operation completes, and the slxsystem process terminates.  The problem is that occasionally the process does not terminate and then will fail to handle new requests (lock up).  Killing the process and allowing it to start back up for the next request fixes the problem.  This was a problem prior to our recent upgrades that we thought the upgrade would fix.  While the lock ups happen less frequently than they used to, they still occur.

Do you have any ideas what the problem might be or how we could fix it?  If you need more information, please let me know.

$resources.Subject: Enable Contract Type field on the Edit Contract screen (from the ADV tab)

TicketProblem.Notes: They want to enable the Contract Type field….also, they want to enable a drop down down box for preset values in this area.  How do I do this?

TicketSolution.Notes:
Here is the catch with the contract (as they are implemented in the default system):
•	The contract type can only be selected when you add a contract, not after the fact.  This is because the contract type influences a number of calculations (days remaining etc) that can only be initialized once.  If you don’t need to keep track of the contract days or hours then you could do away with the restriction.  Remember that some of the calculation may then not work or be unreliable.  To achieve this:
o	Open architect and open the form “Contract Detail” in the system family
o	On the script tab, comment out lines 46 to 48:
?	       pklContractType.Color = &h8000000f
?	       pklContractType.Enabled = False
?	       pklContractType.ReadOnly = True
o	Save and release
•	The contract type is displayed as a picklist which means you can customize the values – make sure you log in the client as Admin, and when you open the picklist you should see an “Add” button that lets you enter new values.  It should look like this

TicketProblem.Notes: Research - find out if there is a way to intercept the "Schedule Activity" call or "Edit Activity" call.  Based on either a global variable or a value in the activity table we would like to be able to call a different, custom view.

TicketSolution.Notes:
Ted, As far as I can tell there are 2 ways to go about this.

1st method is to intercept the call to edit/schedule/complete activity.  You can do that in the Global Activity global script.
For example if you want to change the view that comes up when they edit an existing activity, edit this function:
Function Application_BeforeEditActivity(Activity, ByRef Cancel)
  ‘ invoke alternate edit view
   Application.BasicFunctions.ShowViewForRecord “ACTIVITY”, “Personal:Alternate Activity Edit View”, Activity.Key
  ‘ cancel the stock view
    Cancel = true
End Function

You could check for a global or database variable at this point.  The “Activity” variable points to an Activity object (it is documented in the SDK if you look under “Scripting properties and functions”).  There is a similar function called up when they complete an activity.

In order to change the view that comes up when they schedule a new activity you need to use a different method – add a function similar to this one in the global script:

Function OnBeforeFunctionExecute_SchedulePhoneCall(functionNumber, functionName)
   ‘ invoke alternate screen in insert mode
    Application.BasicFunctions.ShowViewForRecord “ACTIVITY”, “Personal:Alternate Activity Edit View”, “”
  ‘ prevent stock screen from coming up
    OnBeforeFunctionExecute_SchedulePhoneCall = True
End Function

You have to do a separate one for each type of activity.

One potentially big problem with this method is that it  doesn’t get called when you schedule the activity from the calendar.



2nd method would be to not intercept the call but within the “Activity Details” view check for the global and close/reopen the form if needed.  Closing the form is a bit tricky though because you don’t have access to the main form window (you only work within the confine of the activity details tab).  However Saleslogix gives you access to the low-level handle to the form’s window (i.e., a Win32 window handle) and from that you can work your way up to the actual form.  In theory this should be possible using  a legacy basic script which is easy to deploy however I could not get that to work.  Instead I created a small C# component.  The easiest is probably to deploy it as a .NET extension in v7 or 7.2.  I attached the code – you will need to adjust the references in the project to point to the Saleslogix assemblies on your machine, recompile it and register it in the “Manage .NET Extensions” tool of the Architect.  

Once registered, this is how you would invoke it from the Activity Details form:

    Dim handle
  
  ‘ close the regular screen
    handle = Application.Managed.Create("ScheduleActivityCloser", "ScheduleActivityCloser.ScheduleActivityCloser")
    Application.Managed.Run handle, frmActivityDetails.HWND
    Application.Managed.Destroy handle
  ‘ invoke alternate screen
    Application.BasicFunctions.ShowViewForRecord "ACTIVITY", "Personal:Alternate Activity View", CurrentID



Ideally you should probably combine the 2 methods because the 2nd one is a bit unnatural looking (the regular form still pops up and stays up for 1 second then goes away).

I hope this helps.  Please let me know if you need additional info.

Some attachments were imported in the system and may not have been invoiced (there is a bulk attachment import tool that we created for them a few months ago which was used for that).  Tim would like a list of the attachments that were imported between March 3 and March 5, either through a log of the tool if it exists, or looking at the attachment table / create user directly.

TicketSolution.Notes:
Sent list to Tim (see attached).

SQL:
select a.filename, u.username as [Attached By],  a.description, dateadd(hh, -6, a.attachdate) as [Import Date], t.alternatekeysuffix [Ticket #], parent.account Parent, account.account Store from attachment a
join ticket t on t.ticketid = a.ticketid
join ticket_qsi tq on tq.ticketid = t.ticketid
join account parent on tq.parentid = parent.accountid
join account account on account.accountid = t.accountid
join userinfo u on a.createuser = u.userid
where attachdate between '2008-05-03 06:00:00' and '2008-05-06 06:00:00' and a.description not like 'imported work order%' and a.filename like '%.cpy'
and a.accountid is null
order by attachdate

TicketProblem.Notes:
We have some jobs that are not combining 10” metal.  They can select some of this by entering a number in the 5X5 measurement on the bid form.  It is also added for a skylight, skylight reflash, or a chimney.  

Job 41075 is one I looked at for quite a while.  It has 5X5, 3 skylight reflashes, and 3 chimneys.  The detail report shows the 5 different roll metals that are created and that is correct.  But on the job card, the 10” metal combines from 5 into 2, but not down to one.  If you look at the job card, Cheryl has already combined the numbers, but you can see there are two entries.  There are two entries for 10” metal in the c_opp_bid_mat table.  
Detail report:
5X5 = 20 – 20 ft of 10”
Skylight reflash = 3, 3 X 6 = 18 ft of 10” and 20”
Chimney = 2, 2 X 6 = 12 ft of 10” and 20”

The 2 20” measures combined for 30 feet.  This looks good on the job card.
The 5X5 and chimney 10” metal combined for 32 feet.
The skylight reflash quantity did not combine.  It has a separate record in c_opp_bid_mat.

TicketSolution.Notes: Issue with color - when a roll metal (aka 5x5) is selected on the bid it is saved with a color.  When one is then generated (eg from Skylight Reflash) it does not get generated with the color.  Adjusted the code to combine those on the job card (and put them both in the same color).

Bug was introduced in product cost form.

NOTE that if there is a handler on the OK button of a databound form, the data may be saved to the database before the handler is executed.  So it is not a good place to do validation.  Seems to be a new behavior in 7.0 AFAIK.


update c_product_cost 
set c_inventoryid 
=
(select c_inventoryid
from c_inventory
where wood_type = c_product_cost.wood_type and barrel_size = c_product_cost.barrel_size
and wood_age = c_product_cost.wood_age
and productid = c_product_cost.productid
and grain_type = c_product_cost.grain_type 
and barrel_style = c_product_cost.barrel_style
and bending_method = c_product_cost.bending_method
and toasting_method = c_product_cost.toasting_method
and toasting_Level = c_product_cost.toasting_level
and staves = c_product_cost.staves 
and hoops = c_product_cost.hoops
and specialty = c_product_cost.specialty
and siteid = c_product_cost.siteid
)
where c_inventoryid is null and is_applied = 'T' and createdate > '2008-08-05'

$resources.Subject: Effective Date with Timestamps affecting query

TicketProblem.Notes:
Heather created a query in Contacts - Apps in Process that worked in the past but today didn't pull in all the people it should. It took me forever, but I found out that the dates in SLX (we've had this issue before) appear to us to be a set date like 6/1/08, but on the back end - it must have a time attached as well.  So if we pull a query for all members with an C Con Family  - Effective date of >= 6/1, these people aren't showing up because SLX has it set up with a time also - so it's appearing as 6/1/08 2:35pm or some weird time and we can't see on our end.
 
I think this just changed after they updated these because Heather said it worked before but not today and it wasn't updated other than a non-date field.
 
If they could go through our program and change ALL dates to be date only - NO times, that would be great.

TicketSolution.Notes:
Unfortunately timestamps cannot be removed from the field as it affects the exports to Excel.

The best workaround is to pad one more day to the query condition. So if you want to query for effective dates less than or equal to 12/1/2008, it would be best to query for effective dates < 12/2/2008. This should resolve the issue.
Sent her the instructions

$resources.Subject: Invoice Payment Date / Invoice Balance for TDM

TicketProblem.Notes:
Is there some way that you can tie the date of payment that is entered by TDM on the Invoice Payment Screen to the Invoice Paid Date?  If you look at FA4111 the invoice payment date is 6/9/08 but the Invoice Paid date is 6/10/08 (I have a feeling that the Invoice Paid date is picking up the actual date of entry).  We also need to keep in mind that there might be more than one payment posted to an invoice, so the Invoice Paid date would need to change with each entry.

Also, sometimes (I don't have an example) but TDM is saying that it will not always take the Invoice Balance to Zero when payment is made in full.  This is going to be very important when it comes to paying commissions.  Could you look into.

TicketSolution.Notes:
Actually I think I may have found the source of both problems.  As you may recall we had to make a change to the payment grid to allow the users to enter payments when the invoice is not marked as integrated with Great Plains.  The problem is one of the Great Plains integration script was still taking in those payments as USD and recalculating the balance which then became incorrect.  In addition, the script that sets the invoice paid date for user-entered payments is currently using the entry date just as you had guessed.

I will make a correction to both scripts right now.

Thanks
Nick

TicketProblem.Notes:
Issue 1: Weekly Activity Report out of saleslogix (knowledgesync) has a lot of data that says 'New Word Template'.
Issue 2: Import of Account Number went to ExternalAccountNo instead of Client ID
Issue 3: Zip Codes for imported addresses are blank

TicketSolution.Notes:
Issue 1: - 40 minutes 
Report produces a week's worth of activity and tells you what user did what. This activity doesn't check for the existence of an account or contact, and that caused the administrator user to show a lot of "New Word Template" with no account or contact. In discussing this result with Michelle we decided that the best way to approach it would be filtering the accounts without an account name. I re-ran the report and sent her the result. 

Issue 2: - 10 minutes
I mapped the item to the wrong location.
Ran this query:
update account set clientid = externalaccountno where importsource like 'BSW%'

Issue 3: - 30 minutes
The address table missed the zip code. The reference table was complete. 
Ran this query:
update d 
 set d.postalcode = cpir.zip 
 from address d 
 join contact c on c.contactid = d.entityid 
 join c_cpas_import_ref cpir on cpir.contactid = c.contactid 
 where c.importsource like 'BSW%' 

update d 
 set d.postalcode = cpir.zip 
 from address d 
 join account a on a.accountid = d.entityid 
 join contact c on c.accountid = a.accountid 
 join c_cpas_import_ref cpir on cpir.contactid = c.contactid 
 where a.importsource like 'BSW%' 
 and d.address1 = cpir.address1

TicketProblem.Notes: The campaign make calls button shows 0 of 58 but says all calls are completed. No one knows how this button works, so I have to do some research.

TicketSolution.Notes:
The previous developer created a make calls button for campaign. It was laid out very poorly. I had to re-design the interface before I could do anything. (15 minutes)

First thing to do after that was configure a lead and a campaign in saleslogix internally. 

After that was completed, I started to work on understanding the customization. The first thing I noticed was that the tab only works for active contacts, and not lead contacts as these were set up as, so I had to change that. I used a union statement to make the leads and the contacts live in harmony, should both exist. 

Next up, when the call is placed, the history is written to the leads; I had to go back in, and make sure to update that to write the leadID and leadName. 

Then, in testing, I figured out what flag sets the call ID to be 'called'. If the status of the contact is Launched, call back, or attempted, it has not been officially called. Otherwise, it has. Interestingly, it also writes a history item and checks the count of that to determine the number of calls made.

TicketProblem.Notes:
Sean offered the following list of things to clean up: 
Ø       Duplicate Accounts

Ø       Duplicate contacts

Ø       Invalid state codes

Ø       Misspelled and incorrect cities

Ø       Invalid country codes

Ø       Incorrect phone number formats

Ø       Add salutation where there isn’t one(we will use first name)

Ø       Run Integrity checker and clean up any errors

Ø       Setup Speed Search and build the indexes

TicketSolution.Notes:
Step by step summary: 

Ø      Duplicate Accounts

 

To identify a duplicate account, the account name must be identical, and either the address or the phone number must also be identical. They were merged into the account with the most history. 

 

Ø      Duplicate contacts

 

To identify a duplicate contact, the contact name must be identical (last name and first name – titles or middle initials did not play into account) and they must be under the same account. 

 

Ø      Invalid state codes

 

For invalid state codes, I decided to take the address table and change all American states into their two character code, where this did not already exist. I also corrected a few (M0 (that’s a zero) became MO). This will help with building account/contact groups by state. 

 

Ø      Misspelled and incorrect cities

 

As I mentioned before, it’s difficult to do a lot here and identify misspelled cities. I corrected a few, and standardized St. Louis (from saint louis and st louis with no period).  But if it’s spelled for example ‘jacksonnville’ with two n’s, it’s difficult for me to actually realize that this is an invalid city. 

 

Ø      Invalid country codes

 

I went through most of the database and updated the countries to either Canada or the United States for those with the state / province listed. For international, I pretty much left it alone. 

 

Ø      Incorrect phone number formats

 

These were a challenge. I fixed most of them, but there may be a few that are still kicking around in the system. As I said before, the international numbers were not touched as I did not want to break something. 

 

Ø      Add salutation where there isn’t one(we will use first name)

 

Salutation added. Not much to say. I ran a simple sql statement. 

 

Ø      Run Integrity checker and clean up any errors

 

This has been run and completed. 

 

Ø      Setup Speed Search and build the indexes

 

This has also been run and completed.

When on Enterprise Mode in Qlikview, you're able to make a new document with a database connection and add excel files as tables to augment. When in Publisher mode, the option is there but when you refresh you get an error about the data structure changing. Also when in publisher, you're able to use excel and more excel files to do this and it doesn't fail.

TicketSolution.Notes: This looks like a licensing limitation, but when I was working through it with Qlikview support, they said it looks like it may be a bug. They had me upgrade to the latest build (8.2.5464) which did not work to solve it. In later testing, after a little thought, I put 2 and 2 together and remembered the "Qlikview File' button in the data from files option in scripts. When I tested this, I discovered that you are in fact able to load the data structure from a qlikview file with full database access into a report file. It causes one problem and weakness in that you have to refresh that document and then your own document in order to get a full and complete data view, but it's better than nothing.

$resources.Subject: Kristen had a bunch of questions she wanted answered.

TicketProblem.Notes:
My response follows to each question

Canned Reports
1.	How is the Physician Referral Report formatted? How is the information pulled?

Each entry it processes is one referral.  

The data is first filtered based on the range of dates specified upon running the report, and also filtered based on the location code variable (one of CV, EN, GH, LJ, MH). 

The data is then ordered by physician last name, category and subcategory. 

The report is laid out to display the count and charge total for the number of referrals received for each category, and a total summary of all categories of referrals received. 


2. Is it possible to set-up various canned reports for imaging services?
        a. Comparison reports that could measure trending
        b. Reports organized by volume data (listed in descending order) for each modality (CT, MRI, etc.) and for total volume
        c. Variance reports
        d. Reports organized by specialty (internal medicine, family practice, etc.)

3. Is it possible to set-up different canned reports for other services (rehab, cardiac, etc.)
?

I don’t see why it wouldn’t be possible to do any of these. However, I need more details to understand what you’re looking for exactly, for each of these.  In my opinion, it sounds like you’re looking for an application we re-sell called Visual Analyzer. Doug Gangi would be able to give you more details as to pricing and such, but it is a great, robust visual tool that gives you a lot of reports for data analysis that look pretty and are fairly easy to customize (with a little bit of knowledge). 

I’ll show you a screenshot of one, from the generic visual analyzer template: 

 

Again, this is from the generic version of Visual Analyzer – this is for Saleslogix Activities. It is possible to create pages within a visual analyzer document for each of the reports you’ve mentioned with some information collection and produce graphical results like these. This is the best option for presenting data. 

 
Data input
1. Currently data is inputted into Saleslogix from Trendstar. This information is organized by 'referring physician'. Would we be able to replace the 'referring physician' field with 'attending physician' ? We've found this method to be more accurate.
 
Sean is going to have to get back to you on this one. I’ll have him talk to you in the next couple of days. 


Contacts section information
1.	What is the difference between 'service line raw data' and 'service line volume summary' ?

The Raw Data tab is a complete dump of the list of services within saleslogix for that contact. The same data is shown on the Volume Summary – however the data on the volume summary tab has more features associated with it: The ability to filter by dates and the ability to export the results to excel.  Also, if you’ll note, the summary tab contains a sum of all the distinct lines of data (where Service Line, Category, Patient Type (IP/OP) and Payor Type (Medicare/PPO) are the same. 

Vol Summary Tab: 

 

Raw Data:

 

You’ll see that while there’s only four entries in the Summary tab whereas there’s many more in the Raw Data tab. The Raw Data tab is best used for debugging (or sorting). 


2.	If I wanted the volume for a month period, is the date range entered as (4/08 - 4/08) or (4/08 - 5/08) ?

4/08-4/08; which is slightly counter-intuitive, I realize, but it takes from the first of the month to the start of the next period + 1 month. (so 4/08 to 4/08 becomes automatically 4/01/08 12:00:00am to 4/30/08 11:59:59pm). 


3.	What is the correlation between the physician number field and the reported service line representation? I have several doctors who are not credentialed at the hospital they refer, but are Scripps doctors, and these numbers are not represented in Saleslogix. (ex. Dr. Babikian)?

This was a design choice back when we configured the system. I believe Stacie wanted it set up this way (so that there are multiple entries for the same doctor with different MD numbers based on the location code).

TicketProblem.Notes:
Things to prompt for per window:
* exact size (we need to use this to figure out price)
* options

(may hold until after labor for this one)

TicketSolution.Notes:
Questions:
* do we need to prompt for the exact measurements?

   * They enter height and width which gives "United Inches"
   * Types of Windows: Casement / Double Hung / 
    -> different quantity breaks / base prices
   * options may be priced differently according to size (in term of % or in term of flat price)
   * most of the options are the same for all lines
  * Labor = factor of size, but not of options.  We need to let them capture a labor on the material level.  Labor will be same for windows within a certain size level (eg 35/50)

* Doors
 -> specific sizes


-> Cost = factor times price (factor is fixed per product line)

* NC vs RR prices?  Repairs?  Cost?

Have one "Infinity Replacement Window" material (we can add other types of window later by creating new material record and filling in options... assumption is that the options and size breaks will be different for each manufacturer and possibly for different window types for the same manufacturer)
  Linked table: C_MATERIALS_SIZE has the available sizes with price
  Linked table: C_MATERIALS_OPTION has the available options and corresponding premium %  (can we do with material rule?  I dont think so because no % option, and would be hard to make the UI on bid level)
     -> some of those have to be additive, for example "Clear View Hinge Option"
    -> some of these are conditional to window size?  Not sure how we will get that one
    -> some of these may need some extra info (pattern?)
      Maybe just add a "EXTRA_INFO" field with CSV and prompt for them on form if not null
   -> are some dependent of other options?  or conflicting with other options?
  -> should we default some to checked

In C_OPP_BID_MAT: store description, price
      Description has Window type, base size, options
   Add field: SIZEID - this is needed to figure out the price
  Add fields for exact size? (need to find out whether that is needed)
   C_OPP_BID_MAT_OPT: store selected options

Pricing/Costing: 
  * We can determine the unit price on the edit window form.  since there will be no base price on the material record it will be used as a "custom price" even though it is calculated.
   * do we still need custom price in some circumstances?

* should we show the extra info (the stuff in the footnotes in the document... capillary tubes required for high elevation etc etc)

* what other materials do we have?  Do we need to include some stuff on the job card?  What is the job card / costing going to be like (need to have a rough idea but no need for specifics at this point)

The third tab – Vendors Missing Ins Cert – is a list of vendor accounts with one of the following three flags missing: Workmans’ Comp,  General Insurance, or Auto Insurance, or the date not filled in. 

The fourth tab – Expiring Insc Cert – is your list of vendor accounts with an already expired or soon to expire insurance certificate. It checks all three insurance certificates and checks based on accounts expiring in the next thirty days or already expired.

TicketProblem.Notes: See JPEG to see exactly what's happening. It's an interesting problem, to say the least.

TicketSolution.Notes:
The problem comes from the "Vergence Launchpad" application, from a company called "Sentillion". This application does not play well with saleslogix. Turning it off 'fixes' the problem with saleslogix, but without being able to run both at the same time, things are not perfect, and I'm not satisfied with that. 

The best guess I have is that the Launchpad application is causing re-draw issues, because of how it docks itself at the top of the screen. Saleslogix tries to position its controls, and then Launchpad repositions them as well, moving them into a non-visible part of the screen.

TicketProblem.Notes: The problem is the MSSQL server on the SalesServer machine crashed.

TicketSolution.Notes:
(Copied from an e-mail to BWeaver)

Debra gave me a call this morning regarding the saleslogix server being down, so I logged into the server, corrected the problem, and restored functionality to saleslogix.

The problem was that the Microsoft SQL server on the Salesserver machine was offline. I looked deeper into why the application crashed, and discovered that there was a disk space issue on the d: drive of that machine. SQL server attempted to create the nightly backup of the Saleslogix database, and ran out of disk space, causing a crash in the MSSQL application. 

I turned SQL server back online, but I did not resolve the disk space issue. On that drive, there is approximately 247 mb of 50 gb free, at the moment. The saleslogix backups each currently take just under 1 gb of disk space. The best resolution will be to gain more disk space for that machine. Alternatively, the other solution would be to move the nightly backups (currently located at d:\mssql\backup) to another location on the network which has more available free space. 

Something needs to be done to fix the issue today, or the issue will likely repeat itself tonight. 

Let me know if you have any questions.

This is all while logged in as the Administrator user. All of these should be visible based on the current owner. So it's not an import problem, anyways... I may need to log into Saleslogix as a user and see how you're doing it and why it's not coming up.  

Secondly, 

" We also need to talk about what we can do in the future to verify that the number of records imported is correct. I understand that's probably not the easiest thing to do since it's not a one to one relationship…"

This is where things get a little bit more interesting. It's not just that it's a 1 to 1 relationship in the future - that's fairly easy, as I have a reference table for the data - but also that it's a 1 to 1 relationship + existing records that are already within Saleslogix. Off the top of my head, I'm thinking: 

•	Record the time that the import initializes
•	Record the time that the import finishes. 
•	Return the result of Select count (*) from C_MSOW_IMPORT_REF where CreateDate >= Start_Time and CreateDate <= End_Time 

Nothing but the import writes to the C_MSOW_IMPORT_REF so we can see exactly how many records we've imported. 

It seems like it would 'work'. But since that's an invisible table, it also has no meaning to anyone but me. 

That's what I'm leaning towards right now, but I'll probably need to give it more thought.

TicketProblem.Notes:
I see this error when I run the Synch Server on our Windows server: 
Subscription process beginning 
Loading account list 
An unknown error ocurred: "Could not convert variant of type (Null) into type (String)." 
Sync Cycle cancelled.

TicketSolution.Notes:
Possible Resolution 1:
This error occurring during the processing of subscription rules  normally indicates a corrupt subscription rule.  Look in the synchronization logs for the last subscription rule run.  Delete and recreate that rule, then try to run synchronization again. For more information, see How to add a subscription rule
Possible Resolution 2:
Check the ACCOUNT table for Accounts with a NULL or empty-string value in the AccountID field.
1.	Log on to the Administrator. 
2.	Using ExecuteSQL, run the following SQL statement and verify that the AddressID field contains data:

select * from ACCOUNT where AccountID is NULL or AccountID = ''

For more information, see How to execute SQL statements using the Administrator Execute SQL tool. 
3.	If records are returned using the above SQL statement that do have AddressIDs, the following SQL statement can be used to populate the AccountID field:

update ACCOUNT set AccountID = (select EntityID from ADDRESS where AddressID in (select AddressID from ACCOUNT where AccountID is null or AccountID = '')) 
Note:  If the AddressID is Null or blank, it is possible to obtain the AccountID from the CONTACT table, however as Account name values are not constrained to be unique, this process should be verified and updated by manual inspection. 

Updated 9/5/2008:
There were null SECCODEIDs in the ACCOUNTSUMMARY table that were the cause of the issue.

TicketProblem.Notes: I've done a few SLX territory realignments recently and it seems the Opportunity acct mgr doesn't get updated to the Account acct mgr unless I hit each record manually.  Is this a known issue, and do you have a SQL statement I could run to make this happen automatically?

TicketSolution.Notes:
This is probably due to the fact that Opportunities in your system are linked via Contacts and not Accounts. SalesLogix wants AccountManagers to be the same at the Account, Contact and Opportunity level and its driven by the Account value. The joins in your database maybe what's causing this.

If you edit the Sales Process form you will see lines of code that say: grdSalesProcess.ExpandAll

TicketProblem.Notes:
I keep trying to move a contact to a new account and I keep getting the error below and it will not move the contact.  It will only copy it.  Is that normal?
The error message shows "Must assign items to a different user".

TicketSolution.Notes:
It should ask you for another contact in the same account to reassign the items to. 
The idea being that if you for example have a meeting scheduled with John Doe at XYZ Inc and you decide to move the contact to another Account, the meeting still stays with XYZ Inc, but is scheduled for another contact at XYZ Inc.
Since the account only has one contact, the only workaround is to create a dummy contact for the account, transfer the items, and then delete the dummy contact. 
Other than customizing the form to make it work in the way you need it to (which will take about an hour or two because its a little complex to code), unfortunately there's no other way of fixing this permanently.

TicketProblem.Notes: Lisa had questions about the issues component within Saleslogix. I did a gotoassist with her, saw her issues with how it's been configured (can't add a community) and the review team piece doesn't let you select contacts anymore since they changed the name of the contact group from Kansas City Power and Light to KCP&L.

I have noticed since the upgrade that I am not able to Edit (or Copy) lookup groups that I created in Opportunities.  Is there something that I am missing here?  I'm trying to clean things up and am having a lot of difficulty.

Update:
.  No error message, all the tabs are just greyed out and I can't edit anything.  When I try to copy the group I get the same thing.  And when I try to delete a group it tells me I can only delete groups that I created (even though the tab shows my name).

TicketSolution.Notes:
What happens when you try to edit or copy groups? Do you get an error message?
The main difference between groups in the new version is if you create a group and then share it, you have to remove all its shares, edit it, and then share it out again.
Please let me know what error message you’re seeing and hopefully I can provide you with a solution.

Update:
Yes this is a "feature" of the new version, it shows you all the released versions of your groups as well.
So say you have a group called "ABC Opportunities" and you share it out to a team called Sales, you will see 2 groups in your SalesLogix client by default. One will say "ABC Opportunities" and the other will say "ABC Opportunities (Sales)". 
You will need to unrelease this group before you can edit it. Also the ABC Opportunities (Sales) group will not be editable, but the "ABC Opportunities" group should be.

When she closes the window, it reverts to her own personal email address. I need to get this fixed for her if possible.

TicketSolution.Notes:
The word menu being greyed out or disable was a known issue resolved earlier as follows:
1.            Close all applications. 
2.            Access your C: Drive
3.            Select Documents and Settings
4.            Open your personal folder (e.g., dhammonds, lmorgan, etc.)
5.            Select Application Data 
6.            Select Microsoft
7.            Select Templates
         Your path should look something like below, with your own personal file in the middle
            C:\Documents and Settings\dhammonds\Application Data\Microsoft\Templates
8.            Find your “NORMAL.DOT” file, which is the template for all Microsoft Word. 
9.            Generate an archive copy as a backup.
10.        Delete the normal.dot file, then restart Word.  Opening Word automatically regenerates the normal template.
11.        Once that is done, you can close the directory and then reopen SalesLogix. 


The second issue with the email options was resolved by making a minor change to the template text so it forces it to save the email address change.

TicketProblem.Notes: We have a remote user that will be formatting his machine, and he wants to backup his local DB file to restore after the reload, instead of getting a new cut. Are there any concerns or best practices in this regard?

TicketSolution.Notes:
Ideally you should cut him a new remote. However I understand that this is not always possible.

Here are some steps:
1)	Run a final sync cycle to ensure his changes are pushed down to the main server and then detach his remote DB.
2)	Drop down to the command prompt and type:
osql  -E
(note the E should be capitalized)

3)	Type the command: sp_detach_db 'SLXRemote'
This will detach his remote. Type quit to exit. Now copy his MDF file off the laptop (I would copy the LDF file too, just in case).
4)	On the new laptop put the mdf file to his desktop and use the regular Attach Remote provided with SalesLogix.

TicketProblem.Notes: How do I place a custom written crystal report inside of SLX on the reports menu thus allowing the users to print as needed.

TicketSolution.Notes:
You need to login to the SalesLogix Architect as the admin user.
Click on ? Manage Reports
You can then add the report under the appropriate section. Please make sure the report uses the SalesLogix OLEDB provider and not the standard SQL OLEDB provider.

TicketProblem.Notes: Anosh was out of the office so I assisted with these issues.

I have two users complaining of the following problem when clicking on the Write menu and choosing email or letters. Rather than providing a choice of templates, an error message appears List Index Out of Bounds. When I log on using either user's credentials, the menu works correctly.

TicketSolution.Notes:
The fact that it is working on your machine and not theirs indicates that its an issue on their machine only. What I suspect is going on is the registry on their machines has an older template cached and its unable to load that template now after the upgrade.
A simple fix would be to exit SalesLogix on their machine, edit the registry and delete the entire key under HKEY Current User\Software\SalesLogix
When the user logs in to SalesLogix the next time, it re-creates this key and will hopefully not have the older cached templates.

Page and Rebecca,

I looked at the accounts where Status = 'Archive'. As you know, there are 135 of those in the system.

Now, when I did the original import, I created the account based off of the first  record that was found in the system. It was kind of an arbitrary way to go about things, but as a result, if there are multiple doctors within an account, the affiliation itself was imported incorrectly. 

So if you look at the file "Archived Accounts to Purge.xls", there is a list of 74 accounts which will be removed from the system, as well as all associated contacts and affiliations.

If you look at the 'Incorrectly archived accounts.xls' - these accounts need to have their statuses updated.  I'm not certain what to set their statuses to. 

----

Now, the next question is - after we have removed the bad accounts, and corrected the statuses on the incorrectly archived ones, what do we do about contacts?

The way I see it, there's going to be two scenarios upon which we need to act:

1. Contact has 100% archive as affiliation status across the board
2. Contact has 1 or more affiliations set to archive, and 1 or more affiliations set to something else. 

For #1, we probably want to remove the contact altogether. You'll find a list of this in 'Contact full bad affiliation.xls'

For #2, we want to remove the affiliation but leave the contact in the system. You'll find a list of these in 'bad affiliations.xls'
