Account.AccountName: The University of Vermont Medical Center

TicketProblem.Notes: There have been several instances recently where I make some changes to the appearance of lists, or merge records, etc. and it is not showing up on colleagues’ computers, despite my performing a “refresh all” and the other person doing the same.  In one case, it was not until the other colleague had logged off her computer for the weekend and came in on Monday to find the changes were there finally.  Why is the “refresh all” function not working in this case?  I am curious if it has something to do with the idea that I am on a remote set-up and perhaps they are not?

TicketSolution.Notes:
Since you are a remote user here is how the process works. When you enter data in SalesLogix, it saves the changes to the database on your laptop, not the server. So users will not see the change right away.
When you run a synchronization, it sends these changes to the server.
The server itself runs on an automatic sync cycle every (usually every 30 mins to an hour depending on how your server has been set up). When this cycle runs, the server processes the changes it received from you, applies them to the master database, and then sends those changes out to the other remote users.
Finally when these remote users run their sync, they receive the changes on their SalesLogix system.
So the key is if you want the changes to come down to users quicker, you can run a sync on your machine. The server should pick those changes up in the next hour and then push them out to the other users. The users then have to run their sync and it will show the changes on their database. So you are looking at about an hour to 2 hours delay typically for changes to show up.

$resources.Subject: How long would it take and how much work to load an Excel spreadsheet of data into SalesLogix?  All the fields map accordingly.

TicketProblem.Notes:
After seeing spreadsheet, I responded with this: 

Amy,

This is fairly straightforward to write. I would imagine 2 to 3 hours of work, since it doesn't appear that there are anything besides organizations and contacts.  

What I would be creating is a C# application for you using an import framework which I've developed over the past year, which would take the excel spreadsheet (with the top rows removed - the header-row used as the , as seen attached) and would expect the column names to be in the exact format from within that file. (So CIS Customer Name would have to remain CIS Customer Name and if you ever tried to re-use the import and tried to use "CISCUSTOMERNAME" it would not find that column.)

One thing that confuses me within this excel sheet is that it appears that there are two 'organization names' - a CIS customer name, and a Phone Book Customer Name.  (Note: I 

There will be a few things we will have to sit down and work out as part of the design process. Just because I'm looking at it: 

1. When an organization is already in the system, do we check for the address and update the phone number? 
2. Do I check for the contact already being in the system, or will we do a post-install cleanup? 
3. Can we avoid doing lines like 660-438-7173 (pb) 660-826-0200 (CIS) as seen for the "Bristol Manor" organization? If we add a second column for a secondary phone and decide where to map it, that would make life easier;  

Just want to give you an idea of what kind of things to expect from this. Also, keep in mind that if you mis-spell the organization name the application won't pick it up and it will have to be cleaned up in the post-import process. (IE: "Dairy Queen" doesn't match "Deary Queen")

$resources.Subject: View Attachment option on Notes/History tab

TicketProblem.Notes: When a mail merge is done against a contact, it writes the notes history record and also saves the attachment on the attachment tab. You are supposed to be able to right click on the notes/history item and click on view attachment and it should display the attachment. However it gives an error message saying There is no attachment to view

TicketSolution.Notes:
Found that link is made between the HISTORY item and the ATTACHMENT item via the HISTORYID on the ATTACHMENT table. However the HISTORYID being written to the ATTACHMENT table does not match the HISTORYID of the History table.
The ATTACHMENT table has an HISTORYID that is 2 later in sequence from the HISTORYID written in the HISTORY table. Also the HISTORYID in the ATTACHMENT table does not match any history records in the HISTORY table.

Found to be a stock bug and was reproduced in the eval database.

$resources.Subject: Remote Laptop Unable to connect to SalesLogix

TicketProblem.Notes: Remote laptop unable to connect to SalesLogix since machine was renamed.

TicketSolution.Notes:
1) Go to the Command Prompt
2) Enter the command (exactly as you see it below, its case sensitive):
osql -S localhost\saleslogix -E

3) If this command works you should see a prompt like this:
1>
If it doesnt work try using the actual machine name where it says machinename below: 
osql -S machinename\saleslogix -E 

4) Once you are at the 1> prompt enter the command:
SELECT @@SERVERNAME AS 'Server Name'
GO

This will show you what the SQL server is currently called. More than likely this will have the old machine name

5) At the prompt type: (type the old machine name instead of old_name)
sp_dropserver 'old_name\SALESLOGIX'
GO

This will remove the old server name (type the new machine name instead of new_name)

6)Now at the prompt type:
sp_addserver 'new_name\SALESLOGIX', local
GO

7) To confirm the name change:
SELECT @@SERVERNAME AS 'Server Name'
GO

8) I would restart the sql server (go to the windows services and restart the sql service MSSQL (SalesLogix)

Finally go to the SLX Database Connection Manager and edit the connection and test if it works.

TicketProblem.Notes:
I created a Repair Costing report.  It is in production, but not released.  This is how we are going to report costing on repairs.  It should no longer take any human intervention.  Once we have the SQL script running (the one we discussed to keep Labor_Rate up-to-date in the C_Crews table), we should be able to report actual material costs and labor costs.

The report runs for all Repairs with a Finish Date between the parameters Start Date and End Date.
Conditions I set include:
Finish Date between parm dates
C_opp_inv_hdr.Inv_date > 1/1/1990 0:0:0  (We want to make sure the repair has been invoiced.)
C_opp_job_info:estimate_type like ‘Repair’
C_opp_job:lob_code = ‘R’

Can you make the following items work?  I can’t get it work trying to sum things that might be null and doing group totals for calculated fields.
The report sums up contract price and any adjustments to get the field, Contract Amount.
It attempts to sum up (Actual Load – Returned)* Unit Cost from C_Opp_bid_mat for Material Cost.
It attempts to sum up (C_Crews_Timesheets: Hours X C_Crews:Labor Rate) for Labor Cost.
We then want to calculate GP $$ as Contract Amount – Material Cost – Labor Cost.
We then want to calculate GP% as (Contract Amount – Material Cost – Labor Cost)/Contract Amount.

We would also like totals for Contract Amount, Material Cost, Labor Cost, GP $$, and GP % for each Salesman.
We would like report totals as well.  CA, MC, LC, and GP $$ should be totals.  GP % should be an average.

TicketSolution.Notes:
Report name is "Repair Costing".

We need a total per job (C_OPP_REPAIR.JOB_CONTROL_NUMBER) as well as per salesman.

Base table = C_OPP_JOB

Conditions:

The report should have a date range parameter based on C_OPP_JOB.PAID_DATE.
C_opp_job_info:estimate_type like ‘Repair’
C_opp_job:lob_code = ‘R’

Show the following fields:
JCN      Payment Date   Inv Amt             Mat Cost           Labor Cost        GP$      GP%

JCN = C_OPP_JOB.JOB_CONTROL_NUMBER
Payment Date = C_OPP_JOB.PAID_DATE
Mat Cost = FINAL_MATERIAL_COST
Labor Cost = FINAL_LABOR_COST
Inv Amt = SUM of amounts in C_OPP_INV_HDR

Also need to show the GP $ (invoice amount - total cost) and GP margin (defined as invoice amount - total cost divided by invoice amount)

Group by: 
SALESMAN (OPPORTUNITY.ACCOUNTMANAGERID)
PAID_DATE (show total for every week)

It is possible to have more than 1 C_OPP_INV_HDR record per job, so be careful when calculating the sum.  Make sure you do a test including some jobs with more than 1 invoice.

TEST JOB: 47063 (pay date 2008/11/17).  Enter a few more jobs if needed.
TEST JOB WITH MULTIPLE INVOICES: 47064 (pay date 2008/11/28)

To create a test job: 
* use the New Opp button next to the address on the opp form
* select Roofing, Type = Repair, pick a Salesman
* Hit Submit
* Under Bids -> New Bid -> Repair
* add item, whatever
* Click Next Step (next to Status, near the top of the form) -> Bid -> Print
* Next Step -> Contract Received.  Click OK to repair form.
* Next Step -> Contract Approved.
* Next Step -> Scheduled, Make sure for tech you pick "Keith Gabler" or "Dan Power"
* Next Step -> To Accounting
* Repairs tab -> Hit F5 if needed -> Edit Repair
* Edit Compl Date on the right, select Yes, enter some time, OK
* Next Step -> Invoiced -> OK (cancel the print when it asks you to save)
* Ledger & Invoices tab -> Right click, Add, Type = Payment, enter amount as NEGATIVE invoice amount

TicketProblem.Notes:
Anosh,

Thanks again for your assistance last Wednesday regarding the issue we had with NULL values in the Edit Rights field with some of our records.  As always, your prompt attention is very much appreciated.

While we can certainly understand that NULL values are not acceptable in some instances and will thus, throw an error, we have major concerns about the fact that the error actually altered what was displayed for these records, resulting in an incorrect address until the error was resolved.  In this particular case, a user could very easily just click ‘OK’ to the error, as we know users occasionally do, and use the inaccurate information that is presented to them.  Given the confidentiality of the information that we share with our clients, this type of behavior is not acceptable.  Can you give us some details as to why the addresses for these records would not have refreshed to the correct address when the Edit Rights field had a NULL value?  It appeared that all other information was correct.  What would happen if the same scenario occurred with a different field?  More importantly, what can be done to SalesLogix itself to insure that this type of behavior does not occur again?

Please let me know your thoughts on this as we do consider this to be a ‘bug’ in SalesLogix that needs to be addressed.

TicketSolution.Notes:
I appreciate your concerns regarding data integrity. The issue here was not really related to NULL values, the issue was that the team was deleted from your system while many of your records were still assigned to that team causing SalesLogix to bring up an error. The affected records had a unique teamid saved for that particular team. When you tried to view / edit the records, that teamid did not match any of the existing teams in your database, resulting in an error message.

As you know with any application, once an error message comes up, the application usually does not always continue doing the task it was asked to do when it encountered the error. A simple analogy would be if you were copying files in Windows, and windows explorer happened to crash, you would expect that all the files did not copy. Similarly in SalesLogix, if an error comes up one can expect that the operation would not be successful which is why the incorrect data was displayed. I agree, users would tend to just try and click past the error and continue working in SalesLogix normally.

So moving forward, we will need to address this issue as I am sure you would need the ability to re-align accounts and contacts to a new owner / team. We will have to build a customization to do this. Specifically we will need to do the following:
1) Modify the existing script so it handles the situation where it cannot find the matching team in the database. 
2) Give Admin users at MPEG a management tool whereby they can re-align edit rights for a group of accounts / contacts.

For the moment however, the recommendation I would make is do not delete any teams from the system as that is what will cause the error messages. Please let me know if you have any questions.

$resources.Subject: Problem with balance field in credit memo

TicketProblem.Notes:
Nick -

I'm doing a group (TDM or TDM OSG Invoices October 2008) that includes the Total GST (Calculation of Invoice.GST +Invoice.MiscTax) but on the credit memo's I am coming up with a positive number instead of a negative number.  Is there a way to get this to be a negative number?  Does the field format need to be changed?  Can I do a formula in the Calculation field(if so what I tried this but all of my information disappeared)?

Also, the balance field does not seem to hold the negative - on the group when I first view it the credit memo balance is showing a positive but when you go look at the invoice and then go back to the group it will change to a negative.

TicketSolution.Notes:
The amount on the credit memo is stored as a positive amount, and taken as a negative number during the calculations (via code).  Unfortunately you can't do this type of calculation as a calculated field.  The closest would probably be writing a SQL View that would emulate it.  We could also change the logic to store it as a negative number but this may be a bit more complex as there could be quite a few areas affected.

I installed an update to the GP Integration script which should resolve the negative balance problem - please let me know if you still notice any inconsistency.

Did a GotoAssist and found the issue to be as follows:
SalesLogix Mail merge queues the email in outlook but if outlook is not running, it does not send the email until its opened. When outlook is opened, it automatically sends out the message.
Unfortunately they cannot continue to leave outlook opened since doing so causes the SalesLogix mail merges to fail.
So the workaround is to perform the mail merge in SalesLogix, then launch outlook, let it send out the emails, and then close outlook.
Looking into the possibility of them using LinkPoint 360 to directly interact with Lotus Notes so they don't have to use outlook at all.

$resources.Subject: I can’t seem to find the 1,000 + tickets assigned to Everyone from the 11th & 12th. Can you tell me what those are and where they came from.

TicketProblem.Notes: I can’t seem to find the 1,000 + tickets assigned to Everyone from the 11th & 12th. Can you tell me what those are and where they came from.

The sales coordinators alerted me this morning to an issue with Advanced Lookup. This is a feature they use daily, however when they started up this morning it is not working. Everything else seems to be running fine. Where would I look to start diagnosing an issue like this?

TicketSolution.Notes:
I looked at the code for this lookup and found that there is a table called C_DUMMY_TABLE which is directly associated with the lookup. The table itself had no records within it. Without this dummy record, there's no way for the lookup to appear. 

So we have two questions. 1 - how do I recreate this record, and 2 - what happened that caused the record to go away?

To re-create the record, I first tried to just insert a new record. The original record had some funny looking things within it - a 24 character ID field with the ID of "Advanced Lookup", and a create and modify user of "Advanced". Neither of these are in and of themselves bad - just peculiar.  I found this record by looking at the dev site. 

I created a new record using Sql Studio, to see if that was enough to fix it, and it was. However, that record that I created would not be sync'd out to remotes, so I had to delete it and write a simple insert statement and run it through administrator so that it would push out to remotes. The ID I created at that time was 'AdvLookup'. This is important. 

I wrote the following: 

insert into C_DUMMY_TABLE (C_DUMMY_TABLEID) values ('AdvLookupID')

Ran it, syncing to remotes and..... it wouldn't show the view.

I tried again - deleted, recreated. Same problem. I tried using SQL studio, thinking it was something to do with the creation method. Same problem. At this point, I realized I'm looking at some kind of a bug with the code, but I can't for the life of me figure out why this was causing a problem. 

I fired up the saleslogix profiler. (C:\Program Files\Saleslogix\SlxProfiler.exe). This tool is a lifesaver - profiling all requests sent from the client to the server. I saw the request and it was looking for an ID of 'AdvLookup'. I never touched the group (C_DUMMY_TABLE: Group Name of "All") so I don't quite know how exactly that changed, and why it didn't change a second time. I re-created the record with 'AdvLookup' as the ID and presto - it worked. The lookup is showing up again. All network users should be able to see it now,  and remotes should be fixed the next time they sync. 

However, that brings us to problem #2 - what happened to cause the record to go away? 

There is an option under Edit. Delete Customer Lookup. Can also be accessed with CTRL+D, accidentally. If someone hit this option, the record would simply be gone. This is not good. It has to be manually turned off for each user. I'm in the process of doing that now and should be done within 30 minutes, so this won't happen again.

TicketProblem.Notes:
Christy was seeing items in her picklist that other users were not seeing.

She was also concerned that users who do not have those picklist items will not see the data.

TicketSolution.Notes:
When a picklist is defined, there is a setting that says "Users cannot edit items". If this is left unchecked, users will be able to Add items to the picklist (as is the case with your Therapeutic Focus picklist). However only the items that the ADMIN user adds to the picklist will show up to all users in the system. If you login as yourself and add an item to it, Linda will not see it on her picklist. If you login as ADMIN and add the item, Linda will see it (she will probably have to exit SalesLogix and log back in for the change to come through).
Assuming you added the picklist value of "ALL" to your picklist and saved it to the Therap. Area field, it will save that value in the field. When users view that opportunity, it will show that value as well. However if they bring up the picklist and try to select additional values, it will not be able to find the "ALL" value in the picklist and will not let them save it. So your existing data will be fine as long as users do not try to modify that value and select additional items. If they want, they can add the "All" item to the picklist and then select it of course. 
This is why as a general rule, it's better not to allow users to edit items in the picklist. It's something only the ADMIN user should do.

$resources.Subject: A knowledgesync job is creating a massive number of UUE files

TicketProblem.Notes: The report that was being generated was creating a massive UUE file. The UUE file is a temporary e-mail file that it was unable to send. It was 32 MB in size.

Note to self: Never touch this report. 

A while back (I think last week) The report was displaying zero records. I do not remember why. To correct that, I believe it was restored from our database. That report was also incorrect - it was displaying a zero total. I looked at several versions of this report trying to figure out which one held the correct report. I believe I spent too long on this - because there was no way to figure out which report was the correct report. I restored the report from the development box on QSI - which was also the incorrect report. (At that time, we had eliminated all extra lines and multiple activities appeared per report. 

The reason the totals were zero was because of the way the totals were calculated. It was calculated and hard coded - but into a string field. Sometimes it was Null. I remember fixing this way back when I upgraded QSI back in May. So there was something even more confusing going on. Again - why I looked into the alternate versions of the report.

In the end, I just fixed the existing report. It's a crystal report from 8.5, with a manually edited SQL statement (which can no longer be manually edited). I fully expected there to be more problems.

After fixing the report and going through a bit of a back and forth with Ashley - who was having a cached version of the report - as if anything else could go wrong - I'm labelling that report as DO NOT TOUCH EVER FOR ANY REASON :-) Not really. But it was frustrating.

TicketProblem.Notes: I have received a request to add fields to the "Opportunity Lookup form (Lookup Opportunity - Description) on the "Create Note" view. Currently, it's difficult to know which Opportunity to select due to the limited number of fields displayed. What is the name of the form to edit? I have reviewed all the forms in the Architect & cannot determine which one it is.

TicketSolution.Notes:
You actually have to modify the Lookup itself. From the Architect you go to the Manage Menu choose Lookups. In the drop down list for the main table choose Opportunity. When the list of opportunity lookups comes up, select the DESCRIPTION lookup and click EDIT. You can now click on the LAYOUT button and that will display the columns that are shown when the lookup returns results. You can add and remove columns from this layout the same way you can edit a SalesLogix group layout.
Once you are done editing the lookup, just click OK to save it. Lookups do not have releases so users will see the changes automatically, however they will need to restart SalesLogix for the change to appear as usually a CTRL-F5 does not bring up these changes.

TicketProblem.Notes:
I am trying to add a leadsource to ~800 contacts & the following statement is not working (Failed to parse SQL). I've tried several variations. What am I doing wrong?
 
insert into contact_leadsource set leadsourceid = 'LTALXA00031P' where contactid = 'CTALXA007C41'

TicketSolution.Notes:
An insert statement generally takes the form of:
INSERT INTO TABLENAME(FIELD1,FIELD2,FIELD3) VALUES (VALUE1, VALUE2, VALUE3).
So your statement should be
INSERT INTO CONTACT_LEADSOURCE (LEADSOURCEID,CONTACTID) VALUES ('LTALXA00031P', 'CTALXA007C41')

However the CONTACT_LEADSOURCE table also has a few additional fields so you may want to try a query like this instead just to ensure data completeness:

INSERT INTO CONTACT_LEADSOURCE (LEADSOURCEID,CONTACTID,CREATEDATE,MODIFYDATE,CREATEUSER,MODIFYUSER,LEADDATE) 
VALUES ('LTALXA00031P', 'CTALXA007C41',getutcdate(),getutcdate(),'ADMIN','ADMIN',getutcdate())

Finally, this will only insert one contact leadsource so I assume you will be generating similar statements for the remaining 800 or so contacts that need the leadsource. (This can be done quite easily in excel, let me know if you need assistance with this).

$resources.Subject: Question about Adding users and User Licenses

Account.AccountName: The University of Vermont Medical Center

TicketProblem.Notes:
Can you please let me know if we can get an additional user license?  I am not sure at this point how many licenses we have left.  Can you let me know and I can tell if you someone needs to be replaced?  We need to add Dr. Peter Moses as a user, either in place of someone who's left or perhaps purchase an additional license.

Follow Up:
I have looked for awhile now but can't seem to find where I go to add in a new user.  Can you give me some ideas?

TicketSolution.Notes:
An easy way to check if you have additional licenses is to try to add a new user in. When it prompts you to select the user type, if you select "Network User" it will show you how many licenses you have available. 
If you need to purchase additional licenses, you certainly can. Please contact Alisha VanDillen at our office and she can assist you with this. I have copied her on this email.

Follow up response:
You have to use the SalesLogix Administrator application to do this. (Its different from the SalesLogix Client that you normally use). If you have it installed, it will be under Start --> Programs --> Sage SalesLogix --> Administrator.
If it is not installed on your machine, you will need to log on to the server and run the program from there.
